documents.title: YOUR EXPERTISE
documents.description:
Use this agent when you need to audit the UI codebase for internationalization (i18n) readiness and accessibility (a11y) compliance. Specifically:

<example>
Context: Developer has just completed a new feature with several UI components and wants to ensure i18n/a11y standards are met before merging.
user: "I've finished the user profile components. Can you check if they're ready for internationalization and accessible?"
assistant: "I'll use the Task tool to launch the ui-auditor agent to perform a comprehensive i18n and a11y audit of your user profile components."
<commentary>
The user is requesting an audit of UI components for i18n/a11y compliance, which is exactly what the ui-auditor agent is designed for.
</commentary>
</example>

<example>
Context: Team is preparing for a release and wants to proactively identify any i18n or a11y issues.
user: "We're planning to release next week. Let's make sure our UI is internationalization-ready and accessible."
assistant: "I'm going to use the ui-auditor agent to scan the entire codebase for i18n readiness and a11y compliance issues."
<commentary>
Proactive audit request before release - perfect use case for ui-auditor to identify issues early.
</commentary>
</example>

<example>
Context: Code review process where UI changes need validation.
user: "Please review the changes in src/components/dashboard for merge readiness"
assistant: "I'll first review the code structure, then use the ui-auditor agent to check for any i18n or a11y issues in the dashboard components."
<commentary>
During code review, the ui-auditor should be used to validate i18n/a11y compliance as part of the review process.
</commentary>
</example>

Trigger this agent when:
- New UI components have been created or modified
- Preparing for a release or deployment
- Conducting code reviews of frontend changes
- Proactively auditing the codebase for i18n/a11y compliance
- Investigating reported accessibility or internationalization issues
- Before merging feature branches with UI changes

frontMatter.name: ui-auditor
frontMatter.description:
Use this agent when you need to audit the UI codebase for internationalization (i18n) readiness and accessibility (a11y) compliance. Specifically:

<example>
Context: Developer has just completed a new feature with several UI components and wants to ensure i18n/a11y standards are met before merging.
user: "I've finished the user profile components. Can you check if they're ready for internationalization and accessible?"
assistant: "I'll use the Task tool to launch the ui-auditor agent to perform a comprehensive i18n and a11y audit of your user profile components."
<commentary>
The user is requesting an audit of UI components for i18n/a11y compliance, which is exactly what the ui-auditor agent is designed for.
</commentary>
</example>

<example>
Context: Team is preparing for a release and wants to proactively identify any i18n or a11y issues.
user: "We're planning to release next week. Let's make sure our UI is internationalization-ready and accessible."
assistant: "I'm going to use the ui-auditor agent to scan the entire codebase for i18n readiness and a11y compliance issues."
<commentary>
Proactive audit request before release - perfect use case for ui-auditor to identify issues early.
</commentary>
</example>

<example>
Context: Code review process where UI changes need validation.
user: "Please review the changes in src/components/dashboard for merge readiness"
assistant: "I'll first review the code structure, then use the ui-auditor agent to check for any i18n or a11y issues in the dashboard components."
<commentary>
During code review, the ui-auditor should be used to validate i18n/a11y compliance as part of the review process.
</commentary>
</example>

Trigger this agent when:
- New UI components have been created or modified
- Preparing for a release or deployment
- Conducting code reviews of frontend changes
- Proactively auditing the codebase for i18n/a11y compliance
- Investigating reported accessibility or internationalization issues
- Before merging feature branches with UI changes

'Leila M.'
frontMatter.quote: 'Kunden schicken winzige JPEG-Logos fÃ¼nf Minuten vor Druck. Der Upscaler liefert saubere Kanten fÃ¼r A3 â€“ keine Treppchen. Wir jagen nicht mehr panisch der â€ºOriginaldateiâ€¹ hinterher.'

frontMatter.author: 'Nina P.'
frontMatter.quote: 'FÃ¼r die Startseite brauchten wir saubere 4Ã—-Crops. Der Upscaler bleibt ehrlich, ohne Halos â€“ jetzt ist es ein kleiner, verlÃ¤sslicher Schritt in unserem Figmaâ†’Prod-Ablauf.'

frontMatter.author: 'Amira K.'
frontMatter.quote: 'Low-light cafÃ© shots at ISO 3200 are normal. The enhancer removed the waxy noise without halos. A touch more contrast and the files were client-ready by evening.'

frontMatter.author: 'Mika S.'
frontMatter.quote: 'We needed crisp 2Ã— crops for our pricing page. The enhancer kept edges clean and colors honest, so the assets ship straight from Figma without manual retouching.'

frontMatter.author: 'Andreas B.'
frontMatter.quote: 'Der Promptâ€‘Enhancer macht aus Stichworten einen klaren Auftrag â€“ weniger Pingâ€‘Pong mit dem Team, mehr konsistente Ergebnisse.'

frontMatter.author: 'Karla S.'
frontMatter.quote: 'Wo vorher â€šBitte mal schÃ¶ner schreibenâ€˜ stand, bekomme ich jetzt prÃ¤zise, wiederholbare Prompts. Die Texte klingen konsistent â€“ und das Team spart Review-Runden.'

frontMatter.author: 'Alex R.'
frontMatter.quote: 'The enhancer turns rough notes into a clean prompt brief. Fewer review loops, more consistent tone across pages.'

frontMatter.author: 'Sara T.'
frontMatter.quote: 'The prompt enhancer turns rough bullet points into a clear brief. Our team spends less time pingâ€‘ponging drafts and more time shipping consistent copy.'

frontMatter.author: 'Jonas K.'
frontMatter.quote: 'Kunden liefern Socialâ€‘Clips oft einen Tick zu weich. Der Videoâ€‘Enhancer bringt Mikroâ€‘Kontrast zurÃ¼ck, ohne diese Haloâ€‘Kanten â€“ so kÃ¶nnen wir am selben Tag posten.'

frontMatter.author: 'Lina R.'
frontMatter.quote: 'Aus Rohmaterial mit leichtem Rauschen werden saubere Snippets. Der Videoâ€‘Enhancer holt Details zurÃ¼ck und lÃ¤sst Haut natÃ¼rlich â€“ spart uns manuelle Korrekturen.'

frontMatter.author: 'Chris P.'
frontMatter.quote: 'We rescue product clips that came in a touch too soft. The video enhancer brings back microâ€‘contrast without halos, so we can ship social edits the same day.'

frontMatter.author: 'Ivy L.'
frontMatter.quote: 'Export was a bit flat after noise cleanup. The enhancer brings back fine texture and keeps faces natural, so our Reels look clean without the oversharpened look.'

frontMatter.author: 'Diego R.'
frontMatter.quote: 'Wir verkaufen Secondâ€‘Handâ€‘Ware. Handyfotos auf zerknittertem Papier sahen immer unruhig aus. Batchâ€‘Entrauschen plus etwas SchÃ¤rfen â€“ plÃ¶tzlich wirkt alles einheitlich. Retuschezeit: von zwei Tagen auf einen Nachmittag.'

frontMatter.author: 'Hania L.'
frontMatter.quote: 'Voicemailâ€‘Transkripte landen als Tickets. Mit der neuen Pipeline sparen wir manuelles Abtippen und finden Inhalte schneller wieder.'

frontMatter.author: 'Jane D.'
frontMatter.quote: 'Voicemails become searchable tickets. The team stopped retyping and we surface similar cases in seconds.'

frontMatter.author: 'Omar A.'
frontMatter.quote: 'Voicemails become searchable tickets in minutes. We stopped retyping and can surface similar cases instantly for faster replies.'

frontMatter.author: 'Felix H.'
frontMatter.quote: 'Unser Support-Team zieht jetzt strukturierte Fehlerhinweise direkt aus Tickets-Links. Der Webscraper liefert uns sauberen Klartext ohne riskante Ziele â€“ spart pro Ticket mehrere Minuten.'

frontMatter.author: 'Sabine K.'
frontMatter.quote: 'FrÃ¼her Copyâ€‘Paste aus fÃ¼nf Tabs, heute ein Klick: Der Scraper extrahiert Headlines und AbsÃ¤tze als JSON â€“ sauber, reproduzierbar, mit Limits. Genau das, was wir fÃ¼r Deskâ€‘Research brauchen.'

frontMatter.author: 'Lucy W.'
frontMatter.quote: 'Briefings used to take an hour. Now we extract headlines and key paragraphs as clean text and start writing right away. Consistent, fast, and no broken HTML surprises.'

frontMatter.author: 'Mark G.'
frontMatter.quote: 'We pull structured snippets from product pages for QA. The scraper blocks internal IPs and odd ports by default, so itâ€™s safe to run in our workflow. Clear text in, clearer decisions out.'
